events.message: The insured reported a collision involving their vehicle with another car at a traffic intersection.
The claim was reviewed and categorised under auto accident based on the description of the car collision.
An agent was assigned to handle the claim promptly to ensure faster processing for the customer.
The claimant received an acknowledgment of their vehicle collision claim, confirming it is now active.
The client was asked to provide photos of the vehicle damage and a police report from the accident.
The claimant submitted the requested police report along with multiple photos documenting the vehicle damage.
The insurance investigator began the review process to verify the collision details and assess damage.
The investigation concluded with confirmation of liability and documented damage consistent with the accident.
A settlement offer was proposed to the claimant covering all the vehicle repair costs validated by the investigation.
The claimant provided positive feedback appreciating the clear communication and timely settlement offer.
The claim was officially approved for payment, confirming coverage for the car damage after the accident.
The insurance payment was issued to the claimantâ€™s repair shop to cover costs related to the vehicle collision.
The claim was closed after the payment was confirmed received and the vehicle repair was completed.
All documents and records for the closed auto accident claim were archived for future reference.
